sentences.name: 句子 1
sentences.correct: Model Test 1 Section A Directions: In this section, you will hear three news reports.

sentences.name: 句子 2
sentences.correct: At the end of each news report, you will hear two or three questions.

sentences.name: 句子 3
sentences.correct: Both the news report and the questions will be spoken only once.

sentences.name: 句子 4
sentences.correct: After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D).

sentences.name: 句子 5
sentences.correct: Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

sentences.name: 句子 6
sentences.correct: News Report One The Federal Reserve has raised its federal funds rate by one-fourth of one percent.

sentences.name: 句子 7
sentences.correct: The move may have been small, but it marks the first time since late 2008 that the Federal Reserve has raised important interest rates that it controls.

sentences.name: 句子 8
sentences.correct: The federal funds rate, a rate paid by banks for short-term loans, is now one-half of one percent.

sentences.name: 句子 9
sentences.correct: The Federal Reserve Open Market Committee announced the change Wednesday in a statement on economic policy.

sentences.name: 句子 10
sentences.correct: The committee's decision was based on a few factors.

sentences.name: 句子 11
sentences.correct: Economic growth is expected to continue in the US.

sentences.name: 句子 12
sentences.correct: Another reason to increase interest rates was the low official rate of inflation.

sentences.name: 句子 13
sentences.correct: The central bank has said its target inflation rate is two percent.

sentences.name: 句子 14
sentences.correct: It says that rate would help support employment and keep prices stable.

sentences.name: 句子 15
sentences.correct: However, inflation currently is not at the target rate, but below one percent.

sentences.name: 句子 16
sentences.correct: Questions 1 and 2 are based on the news report you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 17
sentences.correct: 1. How much has the federal funds rate been raised?

sentences.name: 句子 18
sentences.correct: 2. What factor was the committee's decision based on?

sentences.name: 句子 19
sentences.correct: News Report Two Nearly 1 000 are known to have died in a powerful earthquake in Nepal, with many more feared trapped under rubble.

sentences.name: 句子 20
sentences.correct: Tremors were felt across the region, with further loss of life in India and Bangladesh.

sentences.name: 句子 21
sentences.correct: The quake triggered an avalanche on Mount Qomolangma, killing at least eight people.

sentences.name: 句子 22
sentences.correct: The government has declared a state of emergency in the affected areas.

sentences.name: 句子 23
sentences.correct: A national police spokesman said that 970 people had died in the quake, and that more than 1 700 had been injured.

sentences.name: 句子 24
sentences.correct: Major historic monuments in the Nepalese capital have been destroyed in the powerful earthquake.

sentences.name: 句子 25
sentences.correct: These include a nine-storey tower— Dharahara, temples and some parts of what was once a royal palace, all listed as UNESCO World Heritage sites.

sentences.name: 句子 26
sentences.correct: These sites are Nepal's major tourist attractions.

sentences.name: 句子 27
sentences.correct: Nepal had lost several such monuments during a major earthquake in 1934.

sentences.name: 句子 28
sentences.correct: Questions 3 and 4 are based on the news report you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 29
sentences.correct: 3. What is the news report mainly about?

sentences.name: 句子 30
sentences.correct: 4. What do we learn about Dharahara from the news report?

sentences.name: 句子 31
sentences.correct: News Report Three The Venezuelan government has announced a 60-day economic emergency to deal with the country's worsening crisis.

sentences.name: 句子 32
sentences.correct: If passed by the National Assembly, it would give the president wider powers to intervene in companies or limit access to currency.

sentences.name: 句子 33
sentences.correct: The order includes tax increases and puts emergency measures in place to pay for welfare services and food imports.

sentences.name: 句子 34
sentences.correct: Official figures suggest that the Venezuelan economy had contracted by 4.5% in the first nine months of 2015.

sentences.name: 句子 35
sentences.correct: The emergency was declared hours before President Nicolas Maduro delivers a State of the Nation address to Congress for the first time since his centre-right opponents took control of the legislature.

sentences.name: 句子 36
sentences.correct: Venezuela has the world's biggest known oil reserves but the huge fall in oil prices in the past 18 months has slashed its revenues by 60%.

sentences.name: 句子 37
sentences.correct: Annual inflation up to September is said by the Venezuelan Central Bank to have reached 141%.

sentences.name: 句子 38
sentences.correct: Questions 5 to 7 are based on the news report you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 39
sentences.correct: 5. What is the purpose of Venezuela to announce a 60-day emergency?

sentences.name: 句子 40
sentences.correct: 6. When did the president declare the emergency?

sentences.name: 句子 41
sentences.correct: 7. What has reduced Venezuela's revenues greatly?

sentences.name: 句子 42
sentences.correct: Section B Directions: In this section, you will hear two long conversations.

sentences.name: 句子 43
sentences.correct: At the end of each conversation, you will hear four questions.

sentences.name: 句子 44
sentences.correct: Both the conversation and the questions will be spoken only once.

sentences.name: 句子 45
sentences.correct: After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D).

sentences.name: 句子 46
sentences.correct: Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

sentences.name: 句子 47
sentences.correct: Conversation One M: You are awarded the CNN Hero of the Year, Ms. Liz. Congratulations!

sentences.name: 句子 48
sentences.correct: W: Thank you!

sentences.name: 句子 49
sentences.correct: M: Do you feel like a hero?

sentences.name: 句子 50
sentences.correct: W: No. I mean I'm surrounded by amazing people every single day who are really, really strong and amazingly hardworking.

sentences.name: 句子 51
sentences.correct: So I don't. I mean I think this award is attributed to everybody's efforts.

sentences.name: 句子 52
sentences.correct: M: What do you think the people in St. Bernard Parish think when they see this and hear that you won?

sentences.name: 句子 53
sentences.correct: W: Well, I hope they are honored— you know, this award is really about them and their families and their communities.

sentences.name: 句子 54
sentences.correct: They have suffered so much loss from the storm.

sentences.name: 句子 55
sentences.correct: What I like to do tonight is to dedicate this award to everybody in the New Orleans area that was affected by this storm.

sentences.name: 句子 56
sentences.correct: M: Do you think this is a reminder to a lot of folks that there is still a lot of work that needs to be done there?

sentences.name: 句子 57
sentences.correct: W: I surely hope so.

sentences.name: 句子 58
sentences.correct: I hope the message is loud and clear that while we are making a lot of progress, there's still a long way to go.

sentences.name: 句子 59
sentences.correct: M: Now, you are a celebrity, you know.

sentences.name: 句子 60
sentences.correct: When we are talking about you, this crowd, and your picture being taken, do you feel that it is unreal?

sentences.name: 句子 61
sentences.correct: W: It's totally weird. You know, I am used to walking around in jeans and T-shirts.

sentences.name: 句子 62
sentences.correct: M: As you are the CNN Hero of the Year, you'll get 100 000 dollars.

sentences.name: 句子 63
sentences.correct: Do you have a plan for the money?

sentences.name: 句子 64
sentences.correct: W: Oh, absolutely, we are rebuilding another ten families' homes with that money.

sentences.name: 句子 65
sentences.correct: It's going right back into the community.

sentences.name: 句子 66
sentences.correct: Questions 8 to 11 are based on the conversation you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 67
sentences.correct: 8. What does the woman think of the award?

sentences.name: 句子 68
sentences.correct: 9. What did people in St.Bernard Parish suffer from?

sentences.name: 句子 69
sentences.correct: 10. What does the woman want to convey?

sentences.name: 句子 70
sentences.correct: 11. How does the woman feel when becoming the focus of the public attention?

sentences.name: 句子 71
sentences.correct: Conversation Two W: Have you heard that an art museum in Indiana has recently discovered a rare work by Pablo Picasso?

sentences.name: 句子 72
sentences.correct: M: Really? How long has the work been stored?

sentences.name: 句子 73
sentences.correct: W: It is reported that it's been sitting in storage for almost half a century.

sentences.name: 句子 74
sentences.correct: M: It must be valuable.

sentences.name: 句子 75
sentences.correct: How much does it cost?

sentences.name: 句子 76
sentences.correct: W: The Picasso could be worth up to four times the value of the museum's entire collection.

sentences.name: 句子 77
sentences.correct: M: I think it's so much of a good thing, in fact, that the museum can't afford to keep it.

sentences.name: 句子 78
sentences.correct: W: You're right. Since the discovery in February, there has been a sea of assessments and meetings with the board of administrators and museum members.

sentences.name: 句子 79
sentences.correct: M: What conclusion did they reach?

sentences.name: 句子 80
sentences.correct: W: They discovered that the very value and rarity of the piece made it impossible for the natural forces to keep it.

sentences.name: 句子 81
sentences.correct: M: So what would they do with the Picasso?

sentences.name: 句子 82
sentences.correct: W: The board voted this month to sell the work.

sentences.name: 句子 83
sentences.correct: M: Well, this is a very difficult decision for the museum's board of administrators.

sentences.name: 句子 84
sentences.correct: W: Yes. The Picasso might be in the ＄30 million to ＄40 million range which I think is probably a fair assessment.

sentences.name: 句子 85
sentences.correct: M: And that's precisely why the museum can't keep it.

sentences.name: 句子 86
sentences.correct: Here, where there is only one guard on duty in the art gallery, it would be nearly impossible to provide enough security.

sentences.name: 句子 87
sentences.correct: W: That's one of the reasons actually.

sentences.name: 句子 88
sentences.correct: Questions 12 to 15 are based on the conversation you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 89
sentences.correct: 12. What are the two speakers talking about?

sentences.name: 句子 90
sentences.correct: 13. What can we learn about the work?

sentences.name: 句子 91
sentences.correct: 14. Which is one of the reasons that the art museum can't keep the work?

sentences.name: 句子 92
sentences.correct: 15. What was the board's decision on the work?

sentences.name: 句子 93
sentences.correct: Section C Directions: In this section, you will hear three passages.

sentences.name: 句子 94
sentences.correct: At the end of each passage, you will hear three or four questions.

sentences.name: 句子 95
sentences.correct: Both the passage and the questions will be spoken only once.

sentences.name: 句子 96
sentences.correct: After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D).

sentences.name: 句子 97
sentences.correct: Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

sentences.name: 句子 98
sentences.correct: Passage One There are many theories about the beginning of drama in ancient Greece.

sentences.name: 句子 99
sentences.correct: The one most widely accepted is based on the assumption that drama evolved from rituals.

sentences.name: 句子 100
sentences.correct: This view goes as follows.

sentences.name: 句子 101
sentences.correct: In the beginning, human beings viewed the natural forces of the world as unpredictable, and they sought various means to control these unknown and feared powers.

sentences.name: 句子 102
sentences.correct: Eventually stories arose and explained the mysteries of the rituals.

sentences.name: 句子 103
sentences.correct: As time passed, some rituals were abandoned, but the stories, later called myths, persisted and provided material for art and drama.

sentences.name: 句子 104
sentences.correct: Those who believed that drama evolved out of rituals also argue that those rituals contained the seed of theater, because music, dance, masks, and costumes were almost always used.

sentences.name: 句子 105
sentences.correct: Furthermore, a suitable site had to be provided for performances,and when the entire community did not participate, a clear division was usually made between the “acting area” and the “watching area.” In addition, there were performers.

sentences.name: 句子 106
sentences.correct: Wearing masks and costumes, they often pretended to be other people, animals, or supernatural beings.

sentences.name: 句子 107
sentences.correct: They expressed the desired effect— success in hunt or battle, the coming rain, and the revival of the Sun.

sentences.name: 句子 108
sentences.correct: What they did was just like an actor might do.

sentences.name: 句子 109
sentences.correct: Eventually such dramatic representations were separated from religious activities.

sentences.name: 句子 110
sentences.correct: Another theory traces the theater's origin from the humans' interest in story-telling.

sentences.name: 句子 111
sentences.correct: According to this view, tales about the hunt or war are gradually elaborated by a storyteller and then went through the assumption of each of the roles by a different person.

sentences.name: 句子 112
sentences.correct: Questions 16 to 19 are based on the passage you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 113
sentences.correct: 16. What is the most popular theory about the origin of drama in ancient Greece?

sentences.name: 句子 114
sentences.correct: 17. What did ancient people do with the natural forces of the world?

sentences.name: 句子 115
sentences.correct: 18. Why did rituals contain the seed of theater according to some people?

sentences.name: 句子 116
sentences.correct: 19. What did performers do in rituals?

sentences.name: 句子 117
sentences.correct: Passage Two Cash or card? It's a question we all face at the supermarket checkout.

sentences.name: 句子 118
sentences.correct: But new research from Europe suggests paying by card may not be so safe.

sentences.name: 句子 119
sentences.correct: A weakness in payment terminal devices used to swipe bank cards has been found.

sentences.name: 句子 120
sentences.correct: The way they're attackable is very similar to how computers were attackable some 15 to 20 years ago.

sentences.name: 句子 121
sentences.correct: So by sending unexpected network traffic to them, you can install viruses.

sentences.name: 句子 122
sentences.correct: Once that is the case then card cloning, the entire copying of payment cards including PIN numbers could become a large scale problem.

sentences.name: 句子 123
sentences.correct: It took a few days to find this weakness.

sentences.name: 句子 124
sentences.correct: And it's just a matter of time before criminals learn the same trick.

sentences.name: 句子 125
sentences.correct: Card fraud is already big business.

sentences.name: 句子 126
sentences.correct: Three billion US dollars were lost to the crime last year, according to a report from Cambridge University.

sentences.name: 句子 127
sentences.correct: Many countries are now introducing new cards with a microchip inside.

sentences.name: 句子 128
sentences.correct: These use a more secure payment system.

sentences.name: 句子 129
sentences.correct: How to solve this problem?

sentences.name: 句子 130
sentences.correct: The most important thing from the point of view of policy is whether the banks are allowed to shift the burden of responsibility too much onto merchants and cardholders.

sentences.name: 句子 131
sentences.correct: In some countries either the merchant or cardholder is held responsible for fraudulent payment. In other words, banks have got off the hook.

sentences.name: 句子 132
sentences.correct: This is where the thing breaks down in some countries.

sentences.name: 句子 133
sentences.correct: Because if the bank can move all the responsibility for fraud onto either the cardholder or the merchant, the bank doesn't have an incentive to take care anymore.

sentences.name: 句子 134
sentences.correct: If that's the case, the worry is there's less reason for banks to invest in better security.

sentences.name: 句子 135
sentences.correct: In that case, the problem can never be solved satisfactorily.

sentences.name: 句子 136
sentences.correct: Questions 20 to 22 are based on the passage you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 137
sentences.correct: 20. What is the main idea of the passage?

sentences.name: 句子 138
sentences.correct: 21. Why is paying by card unsafe?

sentences.name: 句子 139
sentences.correct: 22. Who should take the most responsibility according to the passage?

sentences.name: 句子 140
sentences.correct: Passage Three As the Mid-Autumn Festival and National Day holidays are only weeks away, car rental companies are busy receiving orders from customers.

sentences.name: 句子 141
sentences.correct: Business insiders say the auto rental market has been heating up for the past few years, and companies have all seen the demand rising sharply.

sentences.name: 句子 142
sentences.correct: Last year, the booking windows for the national holidays were opened at the beginning of September.

sentences.name: 句子 143
sentences.correct: All the popular rentals were booked up by mid-September.

sentences.name: 句子 144
sentences.correct: To meet the rising demand in recent years, car rental companies have been strengthening stocks. Riding Company, for example, has purchased more than 10 thousand mid-range passenger cars nationwide and the number in some big cities is three times higher than that of last year.

sentences.name: 句子 145
sentences.correct: Industry insiders say there are various factors pushing up the demand.

sentences.name: 句子 146
sentences.correct: One of the factors is the recent State Council notice that suspended highway toll fees on passenger cars during the holidays including the National Day holiday.

sentences.name: 句子 147
sentences.correct: Most people think they can make use of the benefits.

sentences.name: 句子 148
sentences.correct: Besides the highway free-pass, car rental companies have also made some adjustments to their contracts to bring in more customers.

sentences.name: 句子 149
sentences.correct: One is the cancellation of the daily travel mileage limit.

sentences.name: 句子 150
sentences.correct: In the past, if you drove longer than 180 to 350 kilometers a day, you would end up paying about two yuan for each extra kilometer.

sentences.name: 句子 151
sentences.correct: But now many car rental companies have abolished the clause so that customers can travel farther without having to keep an eye on the meter.

sentences.name: 句子 152
sentences.correct: Questions 23 to 25 are based on the passage you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 153
sentences.correct: 23. What is the trend of the car rental market?

sentences.name: 句子 154
sentences.correct: 24. What is the factor in the rising demand for renting cars?

sentences.name: 句子 155
sentences.correct: 25. What makes customers travel farther when renting cars?

sentences.name: 句子 156
sentences.correct: This is the end of listening comprehension.

sentences.name: 句子 1
sentences.correct: Model Test 2 Section A Directions: In this section, you will hear three news reports.

sentences.name: 句子 2
sentences.correct: At the end of each news report, you will hear two or three questions.

sentences.name: 句子 3
sentences.correct: Both the news report and the questions will be spoken only once.

sentences.name: 句子 4
sentences.correct: After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D).

sentences.name: 句子 5
sentences.correct: Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

sentences.name: 句子 6
sentences.correct: News Report One Two Marine helicopters carrying 12 crew members collided near the island of Oahu in Hawaii during a nighttime training mission, and rescuers are searching a debris field in waters on Friday, military officials said.

sentences.name: 句子 7
sentences.correct: There was no immediate word on what caused the crash or if any survivors have been found.

sentences.name: 句子 8
sentences.correct: The transport helicopters each had a crew of six from Marine Corps Base Hawaii and crashed just before midnight Thursday, officials said.

sentences.name: 句子 9
sentences.correct: No other passengers were aboard the CH-53Es, which came from the 1st Marine Aircraft Wing.

sentences.name: 句子 10
sentences.correct: A Coast Guard helicopter and C-130 airplane spotted a debris field two and a half miles offshore early Friday.

sentences.name: 句子 11
sentences.correct: The debris covers an area of two miles.

sentences.name: 句子 12
sentences.correct: The search includes aircraft from the Navy and Air Force, a Honolulu Fire Department rescue boat and Coast Guard cutters, officials said.

sentences.name: 句子 13
sentences.correct: Questions 1 and 2 are based on the news report you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 14
sentences.correct: 1. What is the news report mainly about?

sentences.name: 句子 15
sentences.correct: 2. When did the incident happen?

sentences.name: 句子 16
sentences.correct: News Report Two A rare January hurricane has formed far out in the Atlantic, the first to form in the month since 1938.

sentences.name: 句子 17
sentences.correct: A warning has been issued for the Azores Islands as Hurricane Alex heads in that direction with wind speeds of 140 km/h.

sentences.name: 句子 18
sentences.correct: The US National Hurricane Center (NHC) said the hurricane was likely to hit the islands on Friday.

sentences.name: 句子 19
sentences.correct: Meanwhile, another tropical storm, Pali, has formed over the Pacific, similarly rare at this time of year.

sentences.name: 句子 20
sentences.correct: Scientists have linked the storms to powerful winds and high sea surface temperatures resulting from an unusually strong El Nino phenomenon this year.

sentences.name: 句子 21
sentences.correct: The World Meteorological Organization has said the emergency of El Nino this year would be among the three strongest recorded since 1950.

sentences.name: 句子 22
sentences.correct: Severe droughts and significant flooding in many parts of the world are being attributed to the phenomenon, which occurs every two to seven years.

sentences.name: 句子 23
sentences.correct: Questions 3 and 4 are based on the news report you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 24
sentences.correct: 3. What do we learn about Hurricane Alex from the news report?

sentences.name: 句子 25
sentences.correct: 4. What do the tropical storms result from?

sentences.name: 句子 26
sentences.correct: News Report Three An Indonesian wounded in Thursday's gun and bomb attacks in Jakarta has died, bringing the death toll to eight including four civilians, police said.

sentences.name: 句子 27
sentences.correct: Officials originally believed there were five attackers, but later said one man thought to be an attacker was actually a civilian.

sentences.name: 句子 28
sentences.correct: All of the attackers, including two previously convicted attackers, were killed.

sentences.name: 句子 29
sentences.correct: At least 20 people were injured, several of them in a serious condition.

sentences.name: 句子 30
sentences.correct: One of the attackers seen carrying a gun and rucksack during the attacks was named as Afif Sunakim.

sentences.name: 句子 31
sentences.correct: He was previously given a seven-year jail term for attending a militant camp.

sentences.name: 句子 32
sentences.correct: The attacks began with a series of bomb blasts at an intersection near a shopping mall and a Starbucks coffee shop.

sentences.name: 句子 33
sentences.correct: As people inside ran out, two gunmen waiting outside opened fire.

sentences.name: 句子 34
sentences.correct: At least two attackers also attacked the police box in the centre of the intersection in a suicide bomb attack.

sentences.name: 句子 35
sentences.correct: The group planned to target government offices and foreigners in other Indonesian cities, a spokesman said.

sentences.name: 句子 36
sentences.correct: Questions 5 to 7 are based 5. How many attackers were there in the Jakarta attacks?

sentences.name: 句子 37
sentences.correct: 6. What do we learn about Afif Sunakim 7. Where did the attacks begin?

sentences.name: 句子 38
sentences.correct: Section B Directions: In this section, you will hear two long conversations.

sentences.name: 句子 39
sentences.correct: At the end of each conversation, you will hear four questions.

sentences.name: 句子 40
sentences.correct: Both the conversation and the questions will be spoken only once.

sentences.name: 句子 41
sentences.correct: After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D).

sentences.name: 句子 42

sentences.name: 句子 43
sentences.correct: Conversation One M: Some students might not know what an internship is.

sentences.name: 句子 44
sentences.correct: Can you explain what an internship is?

sentences.name: 句子 45
sentences.correct: W: Yes.

sentences.name: 句子 46
sentences.correct: An internship is when a student goes to a company to work, but most of the time you receive salary or you do not get paid and the purpose for this is for the student to get working experience, and to know exactly what it's like to work.

sentences.name: 句子 47
sentences.correct: M: So how does one choose an internship?

sentences.name: 句子 48
sentences.correct: W: Well, when choosing an internship, you'll want to choose an area that you like to learn about and to see if you really want to do that.

sentences.name: 句子 49
sentences.correct: M: So the internship is kind of a weird situation because in a way it's free labor for the companies and people want the internship because they want work experience.

sentences.name: 句子 50
sentences.correct: How did you feel doing an internship?

sentences.name: 句子 51
sentences.correct: Did you ever feel like you had to work maybe more than you should have or was it something you were very happy with?

sentences.name: 句子 52
sentences.correct: W: Actually, I was very happy with what I was getting.

sentences.name: 句子 53
sentences.correct: I was getting a lot of experience and through the internship I realized what I wanted to do, so it was worth it for me.

sentences.name: 句子 54
sentences.correct: M: So what did you learn from the internship?

sentences.name: 句子 55
sentences.correct: W: Well, before going to the internship, I liked law but I worked nothing related to law, so I wanted to experience that to know what it is and what the work involves.

sentences.name: 句子 56
sentences.correct: And eventually, I realized after the internship that this is what I want to do.

sentences.name: 句子 57
sentences.correct: M: Fantastic.

sentences.name: 句子 58
sentences.correct: Questions 8 to 11 are based [08:53.68]on the conversation you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 59
sentences.correct: 8. What can we learn about an internship?

sentences.name: 句子 60
sentences.correct: 9. How should we choose an internship?

sentences.name: 句子 61
sentences.correct: 10. Why does the woman think the internship is worthwhile?

sentences.name: 句子 62
sentences.correct: 11. What do we know about the woman before she went to the internship?

sentences.name: 句子 63
sentences.correct: Conversation Two W: So Diego, you've asked me about shopping, but what about you?

sentences.name: 句子 64
sentences.correct: M: I think that I'm a much more conservative shopper so I only buy strictly what I need.

sentences.name: 句子 65
sentences.correct: W: But do you have anything that you can't resist not buying?

sentences.name: 句子 66
sentences.correct: M: Well, I try to save most of my money because I like to travel.

sentences.name: 句子 67
sentences.correct: Instead of going shopping, I try to save as much as I can, and then when I'm traveling, I can do whatever I want and worry less about money.

sentences.name: 句子 68
sentences.correct: W: That's weird because my boyfriend loves to shop. He even shops more than I.

sentences.name: 句子 69
sentences.correct: M: Wow!

sentences.name: 句子 70
sentences.correct: W: He is really good at shopping.

sentences.name: 句子 71
sentences.correct: We would go to a store, and he will just point, like “Just this, this, this. Try it on.” And if they will fit it, “OK. Let's go.” He is experienced in shopping.

sentences.name: 句子 72
sentences.correct: M: Well, I think it's a very bad combination because if you're a big shopper and he's a big shopper, you're a bigger shopper together.

sentences.name: 句子 73
sentences.correct: W: I know. And you know, every time we go out just to the store to get milk or whatever, we will end up coming back with bags of stuff.

sentences.name: 句子 74
sentences.correct: M: Yeah, and you know, shopping is like a really bad cycle because once you buy something you have to buy another thing.

sentences.name: 句子 75
sentences.correct: Like if you buy a dress, you'll need the bag, the shoes and the belt.

sentences.name: 句子 76
sentences.correct: W: Yeah, that happens to me often actually.

sentences.name: 句子 77
sentences.correct: M: OK, so maybe you should stop using your credit cards.

sentences.name: 句子 78
sentences.correct: W: Yeah, maybe.

sentences.name: 句子 79
sentences.correct: Questions 12 to 15 are based 12. What is the man's hobby?

sentences.name: 句子 80
sentences.correct: 13. What can we learn about the woman's boyfriend?

sentences.name: 句子 81
sentences.correct: 14. What does the man think of shopping?

sentences.name: 句子 82
sentences.correct: 15. What does the man suggest the woman do at the end of the conversation?

sentences.name: 句子 83
sentences.correct: Section C Directions: In this section, you will hear three passages.

sentences.name: 句子 84
sentences.correct: At the end of each passage, you will hear three or four questions.

sentences.name: 句子 85
sentences.correct: Both the passage and the questions will be spoken only once.

sentences.name: 句子 86
sentences.correct: After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D).

sentences.name: 句子 87
sentences.correct: Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

sentences.name: 句子 88
sentences.correct: Passage One There are several ways you can find out about the countries and places you wish to visit.

sentences.name: 句子 89
sentences.correct: You can talk to friends who have traveled to the places, or you can go and see a film about them, or you can read travel books.

sentences.name: 句子 90
sentences.correct: It seems that there are three kinds of travel books.

sentences.name: 句子 91
sentences.correct: The first is those books that give a personal, subjective account of travels which the author has actually made himself.

sentences.name: 句子 92
sentences.correct: If they are informative and have a good index, they can be useful to you when you are planning your travels.

sentences.name: 句子 93
sentences.correct: The second kind is those books whose purpose is to give a purely objective description of things to be done and seen.

sentences.name: 句子 94
sentences.correct: If a well-read, cultured person has written such a book, then it is even more useful.

sentences.name: 句子 95
sentences.correct: It can be classified as a selective guide book.

sentences.name: 句子 96
sentences.correct: The third kind is those books which are called “a guide” to some place or other.

sentences.name: 句子 97
sentences.correct: If they are good, they will, in addition to their factual information, give an analysis or an interpretation.

sentences.name: 句子 98
sentences.correct: Like the first kind, they can be inspiring and entertaining.

sentences.name: 句子 99
sentences.correct: But their primary function is to assist the reader who wishes to plan in the most practical way.

sentences.name: 句子 100
sentences.correct: Whatever kind of travel book you choose, you must make sure that it does not describe everything as marvelous, fabulous or magical.

sentences.name: 句子 101
sentences.correct: You must also note its date of publication because travel is a very practical affair and many things change quickly in the 21st century.

sentences.name: 句子 102
sentences.correct: Finally, you should make sure that the contents are well presented and easy to find.

sentences.name: 句子 103
sentences.correct: Questions 16 to 18 are based [18:35.47][15:46.64]on the passage you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 104
sentences.correct: 16. What does the speaker mainly talk about?

sentences.name: 句子 105
sentences.correct: 17. What do we learn about the second kind of travel books?

sentences.name: 句子 106
sentences.correct: 18. What kind of books should be chosen according to the speaker?

sentences.name: 句子 107
sentences.correct: Passage Two Everywhere I turn these days, I see video ads.

sentences.name: 句子 108
sentences.correct: I do a search on the web for information for a book, and there's a video.

sentences.name: 句子 109
sentences.correct: I'm drowning in videos and have no time for anything else.

sentences.name: 句子 110
sentences.correct: I know I'm old-school, but doesn't this bother anyone else?

sentences.name: 句子 111
sentences.correct: There are days I just can't deal with someone chatting with me in an attempt to get me to buy something.

sentences.name: 句子 112
sentences.correct: Give me something to read and the choice to watch a video if I choose.

sentences.name: 句子 113
sentences.correct: But don't try to hook me with a video I won't watch.

sentences.name: 句子 114
sentences.correct: I'll simply delete it.

sentences.name: 句子 115
sentences.correct: The ones I really hate are the ones which put the script up on the screen, so you can read it and hear it at the same time.

sentences.name: 句子 116
sentences.correct: Or PowerPoint presentations with someone reading the same thing I can read on the screen.

sentences.name: 句子 117
sentences.correct: But since I read faster than the person speaking, I've finished reading before they're halfway done.

sentences.name: 句子 118
sentences.correct: So I'm left to sit there and stare angrily at the monitor while I wait for the speaker to catch up.

sentences.name: 句子 119
sentences.correct: Usually, I just close the video and delete the email.

sentences.name: 句子 120
sentences.correct: So even if it might be something I'd like, I'll never know. It's in the bin.

sentences.name: 句子 121
sentences.correct: Advertisers, promoters...give us a choice!

sentences.name: 句子 122
sentences.correct: I feel it's a waste to take so much time to gain so little information, especially when the first video leads to another video, and another, and so on.

sentences.name: 句子 123
sentences.correct: Give me the choice to read an advertisement r watch the video.

sentences.name: 句子 124
sentences.correct: And then if I'm interested in it, I'll have a look.

sentences.name: 句子 125
sentences.correct: Questions 19 to 21 are based 19. What does the speaker think of video ads?

sentences.name: 句子 126
sentences.correct: 20. How did the speaker deal with the video ads?

sentences.name: 句子 127
sentences.correct: 21. What can we learn about video ads from the speaker?

sentences.name: 句子 128
sentences.correct: Passage Three The number one mistake people make these days regarding eating healthily is excessive consumption of processed foods.

sentences.name: 句子 129
sentences.correct: We have to bear in mind that the primary concern for all food companies is to maximize their profits.

sentences.name: 句子 130
sentences.correct: Though many of them attempt to convey an appearance of “caring” for the health of their customers, their only goal is to make money.

sentences.name: 句子 131
sentences.correct: Processed foods have the effect of removing nutritional value or adding harmful elements.

sentences.name: 句子 132
sentences.correct: The damage of eating processed foods cannot be underestimated.

sentences.name: 句子 133
sentences.correct: How much processed foods should you eat?

sentences.name: 句子 134
sentences.correct: Well, the answer is: none!

sentences.name: 句子 135
sentences.correct: If your response to reading that is “What?

sentences.name: 句子 136
sentences.correct: You must be out of your mind!

sentences.name: 句子 137
sentences.correct: I can't do that!”, then please, fear not—because you're not alone.

sentences.name: 句子 138
sentences.correct: Completely avoiding processed foods in this day and age is a bit of a challenge.

sentences.name: 句子 139
sentences.correct: If you can manage to cut processed foods out of your diets completely, then you'll benefit tremendously.

sentences.name: 句子 140
sentences.correct: But if you can't achieve that extreme, the next best thing is to cut your consumption to an absolute minimum.

sentences.name: 句子 141
sentences.correct: Your individual level will be set by your willpower and circumstances.

sentences.name: 句子 142
sentences.correct: How do you measure how processed a particular food is?

sentences.name: 句子 143
sentences.correct: Simply think of food as it occurs in nature.

sentences.name: 句子 144
sentences.correct: If Isaac Newton had decided to eat the apple that fell on his head, he would have been eating 100% natural food.

sentences.name: 句子 145
sentences.correct: Questions 22 to 25 are based 22. What's the speaker's attitude towards what food companies claim?

sentences.name: 句子 146
sentences.correct: 23. What does the speaker say about processed foods?

sentences.name: 句子 147
sentences.correct: 24. What is most people's attitude towards processed foods?

sentences.name: 句子 148
sentences.correct: 25. What should we do if we can't cut processed foods completely?

sentences.name: 句子 149
sentences.correct: This is the end of listening comprehension.

sentences.name: 句子 1
sentences.correct: Model Test 3 Section A Directions: In this section, you will hear three news reports.

sentences.name: 句子 2
sentences.correct: At the end of each news report, you will hear two or three questions.

sentences.name: 句子 3
sentences.correct: Both the news report and the questions will be spoken only once.After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D).

sentences.name: 句子 4
sentences.correct: Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

sentences.name: 句子 5
sentences.correct: News Report One Dozens of homes and businesses in the Australian settlement of Yarloop have been destroyed by a massive bush fire.

sentences.name: 句子 6
sentences.correct: Firefighters are working to contain the blaze which is threatening other towns south of the state capital Perth.

sentences.name: 句子 7
sentences.correct: The fire is so violent that it sets great obstacles to the curbing work of the firefighters.

sentences.name: 句子 8
sentences.correct: John Donnison reports.

sentences.name: 句子 9
sentences.correct: “This is one of the worst bush fires of the Australian summer so far.

sentences.name: 句子 10
sentences.correct: Already it's burnt through around 50 000 hectares fueled by strong gusty winds.

sentences.name: 句子 11
sentences.correct: The fire ripped directly through the town of Yarloop with a population of around 500 people.

sentences.name: 句子 12
sentences.correct: It's thought up to 100 homes and buildings have been flattened with little left standing.

sentences.name: 句子 13
sentences.correct: Police say a number of people are missing.

sentences.name: 句子 14
sentences.correct: Citizens are worried about the reconstruction work since this is the biggest disaster ever.” Questions 1 and 2 are based on the news report you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 15
sentences.correct: 1. What happened in the Australian settlement of Yarloop?

sentences.name: 句子 16
sentences.correct: 2. What made the damage even worse?

sentences.name: 句子 17
sentences.correct: News Report Two The World Health Organization has announced that the Ebola outbreak in Guinea is over.

sentences.name: 句子 18
sentences.correct: The epidemic began in Guinea in March 2014.

sentences.name: 句子 19
sentences.correct: The BBC's global health correspondent Tulip Mazumdar reports.

sentences.name: 句子 20
sentences.correct: “The worst Ebola outbreak in history began in Guinea and the country is now the last of the most severely-affected nations to declare an end to the epidemic.

sentences.name: 句子 21
sentences.correct: This is really exciting news which cheers up the health workers all over the world.

sentences.name: 句子 22
sentences.correct: But there are warnings Guinea should prepare for further sporadic cases.

sentences.name: 句子 23
sentences.correct: This is what people should focus on seriously.

sentences.name: 句子 24
sentences.correct: In Guinea, there will now be three months of heightened surveillance.

sentences.name: 句子 25
sentences.correct: Keeping Guinea free of Ebola will mean communities stay cautious, which health workers say is the biggest challenge.” Questions 3 and 4 are based on the news report you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 26
sentences.correct: 3. What does the World Health Organization announce recently?

sentences.name: 句子 27
sentences.correct: 4. What is the biggest challenge of keeping Guinea free of the disease?

sentences.name: 句子 28
sentences.correct: News Report Three In Canada, three universities recently ran a program to train female students to avoid sexual assault while in college.

sentences.name: 句子 29
sentences.correct: The two-year program was available at universities in Calgary, Alberta, and Windsor and Guelph in Ontario, Canada.

sentences.name: 句子 30
sentences.correct: The program involved students in their first year at the schools.

sentences.name: 句子 31
sentences.correct: The students spent 12 hours learning how to judge risks, deal with emotions, and use self-defense.

sentences.name: 句子 32
sentences.correct: The program taught students to be especially on guard at parties and other high-risk campus social events.

sentences.name: 句子 33
sentences.correct: The training taught students to attend such events together.

sentences.name: 句子 34
sentences.correct: If separated, they should check on each other periodically.

sentences.name: 句子 35
sentences.correct: They should also take extra care in their use of alcohol.

sentences.name: 句子 36
sentences.correct: At least half of the sexual assaults among college women involve drinking.

sentences.name: 句子 37
sentences.correct: About 450 students received the training.

sentences.name: 句子 38
sentences.correct: A group of about the same size received only written information and a brief meeting with the trainers.

sentences.name: 句子 39
sentences.correct: The group that received the 12 hours of training saw an almost 50 percent drop in risk of rape.

sentences.name: 句子 40
sentences.correct: The study was designed for women while effective interventions that target men's behavior are also needed.

sentences.name: 句子 41
sentences.correct: Questions 5 to 7 are based on the news report you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 42
sentences.correct: 5. How long does the program last?

sentences.name: 句子 43
sentences.correct: 6. Who can join in the program?

sentences.name: 句子 44
sentences.correct: 7. What is the main reason that leads to sexual assault?

sentences.name: 句子 45
sentences.correct: Section B Directions: In this section, you will hear two long conversations.

sentences.name: 句子 46
sentences.correct: At the end of each conversation, you will hear four questions.

sentences.correct: Both the conversation and the questions will be spoken only once.

sentences.name: 句子 50
sentences.correct: Conversation One W: The real estate agent called today.

sentences.name: 句子 51
sentences.correct: She said she had a house and wanted to show us.

sentences.name: 句子 52
sentences.correct: M: Did she give you the details?

sentences.name: 句子 53
sentences.correct: W: Yes, she said we could look at a few pictures of the house online.

sentences.name: 句子 54
sentences.correct: M: Let's have a look.

sentences.name: 句子 55
sentences.correct: Is this the right website?

sentences.name: 句子 56
sentences.correct: W: Yes...Oh, there we go.

sentences.name: 句子 57
sentences.correct: Wow! It's beautiful! I love the design.

sentences.name: 句子 58
sentences.correct: M: I don't really like the color of the house.

sentences.name: 句子 59
sentences.correct: W: We can paint over that.

sentences.name: 句子 60
sentences.correct: M: True. I like the size of the garage.

sentences.name: 句子 61
sentences.correct: We could probably hold both of our cars and still have room for a small workshop.

sentences.name: 句子 62
sentences.correct: W: And look at the yard!

sentences.name: 句子 63
sentences.correct: There are so many trees and flowers.

sentences.name: 句子 64
sentences.correct: And of course, there is plenty of room for our sons to play.

sentences.name: 句子 65
sentences.correct: M: Let's see...

sentences.name: 句子 66
sentences.correct: Here is a picture of the master bedroom.

sentences.name: 句子 67
sentences.correct: It's a bit small, but it does have an attached bathroom, which I like.

sentences.name: 句子 68
sentences.correct: W: You're right.

sentences.name: 句子 69
sentences.correct: It is a bit small.

sentences.name: 句子 70
sentences.correct: How about the other bedrooms?

sentences.name: 句子 71
sentences.correct: M: There are two other bedrooms on the same floor.

sentences.name: 句子 72
sentences.correct: It looks like there is an unfurnished basement as well.

sentences.name: 句子 73
sentences.correct: W: And the kitchen! I love the open kitchen!

sentences.name: 句子 74
sentences.correct: I love it! I think we should get it!

sentences.name: 句子 75
sentences.correct: M: Let's take a look at it in person before we get too excited.

sentences.name: 句子 76
sentences.correct: You never know what kind of problems it might have.

sentences.name: 句子 77
sentences.correct: W: That's true.

sentences.name: 句子 78
sentences.correct: I'll call the agent and see if we can take a look at it tomorrow.

sentences.name: 句子 79
sentences.correct: Questions 8 to 11 are based on the conversation you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 80
sentences.correct: 8. What's the probable relationship between the two speakers?

sentences.name: 句子 81
sentences.correct: 9. What is the man dissatisfied with?

sentences.name: 句子 82
sentences.correct: 10. What do we know about the bedrooms of the house?

sentences.name: 句子 83
sentences.correct: 11. What does the man suggest they do at the end of the conversation?

sentences.name: 句子 84
sentences.correct: Conversation Two M: Hey Hana, how are you?

sentences.name: 句子 85
sentences.correct: W: I'm fine. Thank you.

sentences.name: 句子 86
sentences.correct: M: I've heard that you lived in London, right?

sentences.name: 句子 87
sentences.correct: W: Yes, exactly.

sentences.name: 句子 88
sentences.correct: M: Well, I'm planning to go to London for an academic conference next month and I'm really looking forward to it.

sentences.name: 句子 89
sentences.correct: But I'm not really sure and I don't really know what to expect and what I can see there, so can you tell me a little bit, please?

sentences.name: 句子 90
sentences.correct: W: Yeah, sure.

sentences.name: 句子 91
sentences.correct: London is a very interesting place.

sentences.name: 句子 92
sentences.correct: It's a place where a lot of cultures are mixed.

sentences.name: 句子 93
sentences.correct: There are lots of historical buildings, for example, Buckingham Palace and Big Ben.

sentences.name: 句子 94
sentences.correct: There is a very famous museum called the British Museum.

sentences.name: 句子 95
sentences.correct: And a lot of people come and visit every year.

sentences.name: 句子 96
sentences.correct: M: That's really good because I'm really interested in history and I really want to see historical spots there.

sentences.name: 句子 97
sentences.correct: But is there any other thing that I should see in London or I should try in London, for example, is there any good local British food?

sentences.name: 句子 98
sentences.correct: W: Well, England isn't very famous for food, but it is famous because a lot of food from different countries is all gathered.

sentences.name: 句子 99
sentences.correct: For example, there's a very good place called the Camden Market and you can go and buy food from all over the world.

sentences.name: 句子 100
sentences.correct: M: Good. That sounds really interesting.

sentences.name: 句子 101
sentences.correct: I'm really looking forward to it.

sentences.name: 句子 102
sentences.correct: Thank you.

sentences.name: 句子 103
sentences.correct: W: You're welcome.

sentences.name: 句子 104
sentences.correct: Questions 12 to 15 are based on the conversation you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 105
sentences.correct: 12. Why is the man going to London next month?

sentences.name: 句子 106
sentences.correct: 13. Why does the man want to visit historical buildings?

sentences.name: 句子 107
sentences.correct: 14. What can we learn about the Camden Market?

sentences.name: 句子 108
sentences.correct: 15. What are the two speakers mainly talking about?

sentences.correct: Section C Directions: In this section, you will hear three passages.

sentences.name: 句子 110
sentences.correct: At the end of each passage, you will hear three or four questions.

sentences.name: 句子 114
sentences.correct: Passage One The amount and type of food we eat has a great effect on our health.

sentences.name: 句子 115
sentences.correct: Our body needs a continuous supply of energy to fuel the continuous processes of life, such as our heartbeat and breathing.

sentences.name: 句子 116
sentences.correct: If we eat a well-balanced diet, it can reduce our risk of various diseases as well as help us to maintain a healthy weight.

sentences.name: 句子 117
sentences.correct: We need energy to grow and repair our body's tissues, and to power our muscles for movement.

sentences.name: 句子 118
sentences.correct: This energy is provided by our food and drink.

sentences.name: 句子 119
sentences.correct: As well as getting enough energy, we need to make sure our diet includes necessary nutrients such as protein, fats, vitamins and minerals.

sentences.name: 句子 120
sentences.correct: There is good evidence that eating a healthy diet can reduce our risk of illnesses like fatness, heart disease and several cancers.

sentences.name: 句子 121
sentences.correct: Healthy eating is about eating the right amount and balance of food.

sentences.name: 句子 122
sentences.correct: Eating the right balance of food from the main food groups is important for daily health.

sentences.name: 句子 123
sentences.correct: There are four main food groups: fruit and vegetables, dairy foods, meat and beans, fat and sugar.

sentences.name: 句子 124
sentences.correct: We should aim to eat at least five portions of fruit and vegetables each day.

sentences.name: 句子 125
sentences.correct: Fruit and vegetables cut the risk of disease, including some cancers and heart disease.

sentences.name: 句子 126
sentences.correct: Milk and dairy products such as cheese and yoghurt are rich in protein.

sentences.name: 句子 127
sentences.correct: They are also a good source of vitamin D and calcium, which keep our bones strong and healthy.

sentences.name: 句子 128
sentences.correct: Meat and beans also provide us with protein.

sentences.name: 句子 129
sentences.correct: Fat is the main source of energy— each gram provides us with about nine calories.

sentences.name: 句子 130
sentences.correct: In small amount, fat is important for good health.

sentences.name: 句子 131
sentences.correct: Questions 16 to 18 are based on the passage you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 132
sentences.correct: 16. What is the function of energy in our body?

sentences.name: 句子 133
sentences.correct: 17. What does healthy eating mean according to the passage?

sentences.name: 句子 134
sentences.correct: 18. Which of the following are the best in keeping bones strong and healthy?

sentences.name: 句子 135
sentences.correct: Passage Two After two years in our small town, we had begun to know a few people.

sentences.name: 句子 136
sentences.correct: Yet even though Amy had already spent those years with the same group of students, no one from her class chose to get to know her and become her friend.

sentences.name: 句子 137
sentences.correct: And no one picked her to be on their team in gym class or for class activities.

sentences.name: 句子 138
sentences.correct: She begged me to talk to the teacher because the teacher may allow me to talk to the kids, but the teacher replied, “No, we don't need to tell the students anything about her disabilities.

sentences.name: 句子 139
sentences.correct: You know how mean children can be.

sentences.name: 句子 140
sentences.correct: This will only single her out.” As the start of school drew closer, Amy begged me to talk to the new teacher.

sentences.name: 句子 141
sentences.correct: This year's teacher agreed to let me talk to the kids.

sentences.name: 句子 142
sentences.correct: I asked the kids to put one hand in their lap or behind their back.

sentences.name: 句子 143
sentences.correct: Then I asked them to tie shoelaces with the other hand only.

sentences.name: 句子 144
sentences.correct: Some students began working in pairs to have two hands available for the job.

sentences.name: 句子 145
sentences.correct: Some attempted it on their own and frustration soon showed on their faces and in their actions.

sentences.name: 句子 146
sentences.correct: Finally one boy put up his hand and said he couldn't do this with one hand and he needed help.

sentences.name: 句子 147
sentences.correct: The rest of his classmates nodded in agreement.

sentences.name: 句子 148
sentences.correct: I began to simply explain brain injury to the class.

sentences.name: 句子 149
sentences.correct: I personalized all the information by sharing Amy's story.

sentences.name: 句子 150
sentences.correct: Brain damage due to the stroke she suffered at birth caused both these conditions as well as learning disabilities.

sentences.name: 句子 151
sentences.correct: I smiled as I watched awareness show in the faces of her classmates.

sentences.name: 句子 152
sentences.correct: Questions 19 to 22 are based on the passage you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 153
sentences.correct: 19. What can we infer about Amy from the passage?

sentences.name: 句子 154
sentences.correct: 20. How did the first teacher think of telling the kids about Amy's disabilities?

sentences.name: 句子 155
sentences.correct: 21. Why did the speaker ask kids to tie shoelaces with one hand?

sentences.name: 句子 156
sentences.correct: 22. What can we infer about Amy's classmates?

sentences.name: 句子 157
sentences.correct: Passage Three Young people are becoming more and more nostalgic, which means they are always thinking affectionately about experiences that they had in the past.

sentences.name: 句子 158
sentences.correct: The Internet has a lot to do with this.

sentences.name: 句子 159
sentences.correct: It's certainly true that the Internet has changed the past and will continue to do so, but are young people really more nostalgic?

sentences.name: 句子 160
sentences.correct: History is an array of invisible events, hidden in darkness.

sentences.name: 句子 161
sentences.correct: Archaeological evidence and the written language were previously our only insights into what once happened.

sentences.name: 句子 162
sentences.correct: The invention of the printing press was a major milestone in our ability to engage with history.

sentences.name: 句子 163
sentences.correct: The Internet, though, appears to be set to surpass even that.

sentences.name: 句子 164
sentences.correct: The Internet will perform as a window into the past, consisting of tiny units of digital data.

sentences.name: 句子 165
sentences.correct: Even just a few years from now we'll be surrounded by the first generation of adults who grew up with the Internet.

sentences.name: 句子 166
sentences.correct: The majority of these individual lives will be eternalized online.

sentences.name: 句子 167
sentences.correct: In fact, nostalgia is more about our own reconstruction of the past than anything else.

sentences.name: 句子 168
sentences.correct: Yet the Internet makes nostalgia more difficult to feel.

sentences.name: 句子 169
sentences.correct: It does the work of constructing the past for us, meaning that our imaginations play a considerably smaller role.

sentences.name: 句子 170
sentences.correct: Those dependent on the Internet are not more nostalgic, but less.

sentences.name: 句子 171
sentences.correct: The Internet has the potential to undo the mysteries of the past.

sentences.name: 句子 172
sentences.correct: As a result, we will imagine less of the past.

sentences.name: 句子 173
sentences.correct: Perhaps nostalgia is most fully contained in those elements of the past that are retrospectively unreal, created by our imaginations.

sentences.name: 句子 174
sentences.correct: Nostalgia is a kind of ancient, irrational wisdom, and the Internet, with its floods of information, threatens to drown it.

sentences.name: 句子 175
sentences.correct: Questions 23 to 25 are based on the passage you have just heard.

sentences.name: 句子 176
sentences.correct: 23. What were once the only insights into history according to the passage?

sentences.name: 句子 177
sentences.correct: 24. What does nostalgia really mean to us?

sentences.name: 句子 178
sentences.correct: 25. What's the impact of the Internet on nostalgia?

sentences.name: 句子 179
sentences.correct: This is the end of listening comprehension.
